ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC CAS; 
    ...CASL statements... 
    RUN;
    QUIT; 

The CAS procedure enables you to interact with SAS Cloud Analytic Services (CAS) from the SAS client 
by providing you a programming environment based on the CASL language specification. The programming 
environment enables you to run CAS actions and use the results to prepare the parameters for another action. 

PROC CAS does not have any required or optional arguments. Once PROC CAS is executed, it will continue 
running until it reaches one of the following: 
  o a DATA step 
  o another PROC step 
  o the QUIT statement 
  o an error condition that prevents the progress of the procedure. 
  
At that point, you will have to execute PROC CAS again using the syntax above.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: <ACTION> <action-set-name.>action-name <RESULT= <variable> <STATUS = <rc> <ASYNC = name> <parameters>; 

<action-set-name.>action-name
  specifies the action to run. 
action-set-name
  specifies the name of the action set that contains the action to run. Examples are table, simple, and network. 
action-name
  specifies the name of the action to run. Examples are loadTable, listActions, and serverStatus. 
Example:
  For example, the following statement executes the loadTable action in the table action set:
    
    action table.loadTable / path="cholesterol.csv";

      
Runs SAS Cloud Analytic Services actions.

Syntax: <ACTION> table.loadTable <result=results> <status=rc> / <parameters>;
      
Loads a table from a caslib's data source.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RESULT=caslib |  tableName
          
caslib
  The result is a string. You can access the value from results.caslib. 
tableName
  The result is a string. You can access the value from results.tableName.

Syntax: STATUS=rc 
          
Stores the status code of the action in a variable.

Syntax: attrTable="string"
          
Specifies the name of an existing extended attributes table to use with an ADD, UPDATE, or CONVERT 
task. For CONVERT, this parameter names the table to use for storing the extended attributes.

Syntax: casOut={casouttablebasic}
          
Specifies the settings for an output table.
  Long form: casOut={name="table-name"} 
  Shortcut form: casOut="table-name" 
  
The casouttablebasic value can be one or more of the following:
caslib="string"
  specifies the name of the caslib to use.
indexVars={"variable-name-1" <, "variable-name-2", ...>}
  specifies the list of variables to create indexes for in the output data
label="string"
  specifies the descriptive label to associate with the table.
name="table-name"
  specifies the name to associate with the table.
onDemand=TRUE | FALSE
  This parameter is deprecated.
  Default: TRUE
promote=TRUE | FALSE
  when set to True, adds the output table with a global scope.
replace=TRUE | FALSE
  when set to True, overwrites an existing table with the same name.
  Default: FALSE
replication=integer
  specifies the number of copies of the table to make for fault tolerance.
  Default: 1

Syntax: caslib="string" 
          
Specifies the name of the caslib to use.

Alias: sourceCaslib=

Syntax: DATASOURCEOPTIONS=|DATASOURCE=|OPTIONS={clouddex-parameters | db2-parameters | dnfs-parameters | 
esp-parameters | hadoop-parameters | hana-parameters | hdfs-parameters | impala-parameters |
jdbc-parameters | odbc-parameters | oracle-parameters | path-parameters | postgres-parameters | 
redshift-parameters | s3-parameters | spark-parameters | spde-parameters | sqlserver-parameters | 
teradata-parameters | vertica-parameters}
          
Specifies data source options.

Syntax: groupByMode="NOSORT" | "REDISTRIBUTE"
          
Specifies how to create groups.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Group the data without sorting on each machine, and then group the data again on the controller.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Transfer rows between nodes to guarantee ordering within groups. This method is slower.

The value that you specify for fileType determines the other parameters that apply.

Syntax: loadAttrs=TRUE | FALSE 
          
When set to True, attributes are automatically loaded from a file that is named table-name.ATTRS.sashdat.

Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Attributes are automatically loaded from a file that is named table-name.ATTRS.sashdat.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Attributes are not automatically loaded.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: orderBy={{casinvardesc-1} <, {casinvardesc-2}, ...>}
          
Specifies the variables to use for ordering observations within partitions. This parameter applies 
to partitioned tables, or it can be combined with variables that are specified in the groupBy parameter 
when the value of the groupByMode parameter is set to REDISTRIBUTE.

See the documentation for loadtable action for casinvardesc options.

Syntax: path="string"
          
Specifies the file, directory, or table name.

Syntax: promote=TRUE | FALSE 
          
When set to True, the view is added with a global scope. This enables other sessions to access 
the table, subject to access controls. The target caslib must also have a global scope. 

Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The view is added with a global scope.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The view is added without a global scope

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: readAhead=TRUE | FALSE 
          
When set to True, loads the table into memory immediately. By default, a table is loaded into memory when it is first used. 

Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Loads the table into memory immediately.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A table is loaded into memory when it is first used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, the new caslib does not become the active caslib.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, the caslib will be a visible caslib.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: name="string" | lib="string" | caslib="string"
          
Specifies the name of the caslib to add.

Syntax: permission="GROUPREAD" | "GROUPWRITE" | "GROUPWRITEPUBLICREAD" | "PRIVATE" | "PUBLICREAD" | "PUBLICWRITE" | integer
          
Specifies the host access controls on the caslib when directory creation is requested.

GroupRead
  Read access is granted to the owning group with Read and Write access to the owner of the file or directory. 
GroupWrite
  Read and Write access are granted to the owner of the file or directory and to the owning group. 
GroupWritePublicRead
  Read access is granted to everyone with Read and Write access granted to the owner of the file or directory 
  and the owning group. 
Private
  Read and Write access are granted only to the owner of the file or directory.
PublicRead
  Read access is granted to everyone with Read and Write access to the owner of the file or directory. 
PublicWrite
  Read and Write access are granted to everyone.

Syntax: session=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, the caslib is scoped to the current session only. Tables that you load in this 
session cannot be accessed from other sessions. If you specify False, then the caslib is visible 
to other sessions, subject to access controls. 

Default: TRUE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, the caslib is scoped to the current session only.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: If you specify False, then the caslib is visible to other sessions, subject to access controls.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: subDirectories=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, tables and files in subdirectories of the path specified in the caslib definition are accessible from the caslib. 

Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, tables and files in subdirectories of the path specified in the caslib definition  are accessible from the caslib.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to True, tables and files in subdirectories of the path specified in the caslib definition  are not accessible from the caslib.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, the caslib will be a transient caslib.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, the caslib will not be a transient caslib.

Specifies the caslib that contains the table that you want to use with the action. By default,

Default: SUM

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies the node aggregation level for the table details.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies the partition aggregation level for the table details.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: name="table-name"
          
Specifies the table name.

Syntax: perNode=integer
          
Specifies the maximum number of blocks to report from any node. This parameter helps limit the 
result size for large tables with a lot of blocks. 

Default: 100
Minimum value: 0

Syntax: showMem=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, the results include memory information such as data size, mapped memory, unmapped 
memory, and allocated memory. 

Default: TRUE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, the results include memory information such as data size, mapped memory, unmapped  memory, and allocated memory.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, the results don't include memory information.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: <ACTION> table.alterTable <result=results> <status=rc> / parameters ; 
      
Rename tables, change labels and formats, drop columns.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RESULT=results
          
Stores the results of the action in a variable.

Syntax: STATUS=rc 
          
Stores the status code of the action in a variable.

Syntax: caslib="string"
          
Specifies the caslib that contains the table that you want to use with the action. By default, 
the active caslib is used. Specify a value only if you need to access a table from a different 
caslib.

Syntax: columns={{AlterTableColumn-1} <, {AlterTableColumn-2}, ...>}
          
Specifies how to alter columns. After you specify the column name, you can drop a column or assign 
a new format, label, or name. 

The AlterTableColumn value can be one or more of the following:
  drop=TRUE | FALSE
    Default: FALSE
  format="string"
  label="string"
  name="variable-name"
  rename="string"

Syntax: label="string"
          
Specifies a new label for the table.

Syntax: name="table-name"
          
Specifies the table name.

Syntax: rename="string"
          
Specifies a new name for the table.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: <ACTION> table.attribute <result=results> <status=rc> / parameters ;
      
Manages extended table attributes.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RESULT=results
          
Stores the results of the action in a variable.

Syntax: STATUS=rc 
          
Stores the status code of the action in a variable.

Syntax: attributes={{casattribute-1} <, {casattribute-2}, ...>}
          
Specifies the extended attributes. You must specify the set parameter if you specify this parameter. 

The casattribute value can be one or more of the following:

column="string"
  specifies a column name from the in-memory table that is specified in the name parameter.
key="string"
  specifies the key name for this attribute.
value="string" | 64-bit-integer | integer | double | binary-large-object
  specifies the value for this attribute.

Syntax: caslib="string"
          
Specifies the target caslib for the extended attributes table.

Syntax: name="string"
          
Specifies the name for the extended attributes table.

Syntax: set="string"
          
Specifies the name for the extended attributes set.

Syntax: table="string"
          
Specifies the name of an existing extended attributes table to use with an ADD, UPDATE, or CONVERT 
task. For CONVERT, this parameter names the table to use for storing the extended attributes.

Syntax: task="ADD" | "CONVERT" | "DROP" | "EXPORT" | "UPDATE"
          
Specifies the task to perform.

Default: ADD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to perform an ADD task.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to perform a CONVERT task.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies to perform a DROP task.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies to perform an EXPORT task.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies to perform an UPDATE task.

Create indexes on one or more table variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RESULT=results
          
Stores the results of the action in a variable.

Syntax: STATUS=rc 
          
Stores the status code of the action in a variable.

Syntax: casOut={casouttablebasic}
          
Specifies the settings for an output table.
  Long form: casOut={name="table-name"} ,  Shortcut form: casOut="table-name" 
  
The casouttablebasic value can be one or more of the following:
caslib="string" specifies the name of the caslib to use.
compress=TRUE | FALSE
  when set to True, data compression is applied to the table. Default is FALSE.
indexVars={"variable-name-1" <, "variable-name-2", ...>}
  specifies the list of variables to create indexes for in the output data
label="string"
  specifies the descriptive label to associate with the table.
maxMemSize=64-bit-integer
  specifies the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, that each thread should allocate for in-memory 
  blocks before converting to a memory-mapped file.
name="table-name"
  specifies the name to associate with the table.
onDemand=TRUE | FALSE
  This parameter is deprecated. Default is TRUE.
promote=TRUE | FALSE
  Adds the output table with a global scope. Default is FALSE.
replace=TRUE | FALSE
  when set to True, overwrites an existing table with the same name. Default is FALSE.
replication=integer
  specifies the number of copies of the table to make for fault tolerance. Default is 1. Minimum value: 0
timeStamp="string"
  specifies the timestamp to apply to the table.

Syntax: table={castable}
          
Specifies the table the index is for.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: copies=integer
          
Specifies the number of redundant copies to make for the rows. Larger values provide greater fault 
tolerance for node failures but use more memory. Specifying 0 results in no fault tolerance in the 
event of a node failure. 

Minimum value: -1

Syntax: DATASOURCEOPTIONS=|DATASOURCE=|OPTIONS={clouddex-parameters | db2-parameters | dnfs-parameters | 
esp-parameters | hadoop-parameters | hana-parameters | hdfs-parameters | impala-parameters |
jdbc-parameters | odbc-parameters | oracle-parameters | path-parameters | postgres-parameters | 
redshift-parameters | s3-parameters | spark-parameters | spde-parameters | sqlserver-parameters | 
teradata-parameters | vertica-parameters}
          
Specifies data source options.

Syntax:name="string"
          
Specifies the table name.

Syntax: permission="GROUPREAD" | "GROUPWRITE" | "GROUPWRITEPUBLICREAD" | "PRIVATE" | "PUBLICREAD" | 
"PUBLICWRITE" | integer

Specifies the host access controls on the saved file.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Read access is granted to the owning group with Read and Write access to the owner of the file or directory.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Read and Write access are granted to the owner of the file or directory and to the owning group.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Read access is granted to everyone with Read and Write access granted to the owner of the file or  directory and the owning group.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Read and Write access are granted only to the owner of the file or directory.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Read access is granted to everyone with Read and Write access to the owner of the file or directory.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Read and Write access are granted to everyone.

Syntax: RESULT=results
          
Stores the results of the action in a variable.

Syntax: STATUS=rc 
          
Stores the status code of the action in a variable.

Syntax: covariance=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, creates a table of the variance/covariance matrix.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, creates a table of the variance/covariance matrix.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, does not create a table of the variance/covariance matrix.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: csscp=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, creates a table of the corrected sum of squares and cross-products.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: When set to True, creates a table of the corrected sum of squares and cross-products.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When set to False, does not create a table of the corrected sum of squares and cross-products.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: descriptiveStats=TRUE | FALSE
          
when set to True, univariate descriptive statistics are generated for the analysis variables.

Default:TRUE

Syntax: excludeNonPosWgt=TRUE | FALSE
          
When set to True, excludes from the analysis observations that have nonpositive weight values.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Excludes from the analysis observations that have nonpositive weight values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Does not exclude from the analysis observations that have nonpositive weight values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: excludePairStats=TRUE | FALSE
          
when set to True, suppresses the display of statistics associated with pairwise deletion.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to suppress the display of statistics associated with pairwise deletion
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to suppress the display of statistics associated with pairwise deletion

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

When set to True, suppresses the computation of the probabilities that are associated with each correlation coefficient.

Default:TRUE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to suppress the computation of the probabilities that are associated with each correlation coefficient.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to suppress the computation of the probabilities that are associated with each correlation coefficient.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: freq="variable-name" | frequency="variable-name"
          
Specifies a numeric variable that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation.

Syntax: groupByLimit=64-bit-integer
          
Specifies the maximum number of levels in a group-by set. When the server determines this number 
of levels, the server stops and does not return a result. Specify this parameter if you want to 
avoid creating large result sets in group-by operations.

Minimum value:1

Syntax: inputs={{casinvardesc-1} <, {casinvardesc-2}, ...>}
          
Specifies the input variables for the analysis.

When set to True, listwise deletion is applied to observations with missing values.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that listwise deletion is applied to observations with missing values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that listwise deletion is not applied to observations with missing values.

Specifies the numeric variables with which correlations of the INPUT parameter variables 
are to be computed.

See the documentation for correlation action for casinvardesc options.

When set to True, displays ordered correlation coefficients.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to display ordered correlation coefficients.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to display ordered correlation coefficients.

When set to True, creates a table of the sum of squares and cross-products.

Default:FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to create a table of the sum of squares and cross-products.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to create a table of the sum of squares and cross-products.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

DefaultFALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies not to create a table of variable information.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

Specifies the variance divisor in the calculation of variances and covariances.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Divides by the degrees of freedom.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Divides by the number of observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Divides by the sum of weights minus one.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Divides by the sum of weights.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

Stores the results of the action in a variable.

Syntax: STATUS=rc

Specifies the level of significance for 100*(1-ciAlpha)% confidence intervals. The default value 
of 0.05 results in 95% confidence intervals.

Default:0.05
Range:(0, 1)

Specifies the type of confidence interval.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a right confidence interval.

avoid creating large result sets in group-by operations.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DATTRMAP=table-var
          
Specifies the SG attribute map data set that you want to use. You specify this option only if you 
are using an attribute map to control visual attributes of the graph.

Syntax: RATTRMAP=table-var
          
Specifies the range attribute map data set that you want to use. You specify this option only 
if you are using a range attribute map to control visual attributes of the graph.

Syntax: SGANNO=table-var
          
Specifies the SG annotation data set that you want to use. You specify this option 
only if you are using the SG annotation feature to annotate your graph.
Specifies that plots are drawn with unique attributes in the graph.
Specifies that plots are not drawn with unique attributes in the graph.

Disables automatic legends from being generated. By default, legends are created 
automatically for some plots, depending on their content.
Specifies that plots are not drawn with border.

Turns off the display of the graph wall. This option might be useful when your graph contains an 
annotation, and the wall color interferes with that annotation.
Specifies that the graph background is transparent.

Syntax: PAD= dimension<units> | (pad-options)]
      
Specifies the amount of extra space that is reserved inside the border of an annotated graph. 

You specify this option only if you are using the SG annotation feature to annotate your graph.  
This option creates margins around the graph for company logos, annotated notes, and so on. You 
can also specify the unit of measurement. The default unit is pixels. Use pad options to create 
non-uniform padding. Edges that are not assigned padding are padded with the default amount. 

pad-options can be one or more of the following: 

  LEFT= dimension<units> 
    specifies the amount of extra space to add to the left edge. 
  RIGHT= dimension<units> 
    specifies the amount of extra space to add to the right edge. 
  TOP= dimension<units> 
    specifies the amount of extra space to add to the top edge. 
  BOTTOM= dimension<units> 
    specifies the amount of extra space to add to the bottom edge.
Syntax: PCTLEVEL= GRAPH | BY | GROUP

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The percentages across the entire graph round up to 100%.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The percentages within each BY-group round up to 100%.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The percentages across groups within a category round up to 100%.                                  Interaction: For this value to take effect, the GROUP= option must be specified in the plot statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PCTNDEC= int
          
Specifies the number of decimal spaces to be used to calculate the percent values.

Syntax: ASPECT= number 
          
Specifies the aspect ratio of the plot’s wall area.
Syntax: UNIFORM= GROUP | SCALE | XSCALE | XSCALEGROUP | YSCALE | YSCALEGROUP | ALL

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the legend group values are shared between all of the levels of the BY variable(s).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the axis scaling is shared between all of the levels of the BY variable(s).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the X axis scaling is shared between all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.  The Y axes are unaffected
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that the Y axis scaling is shared between all of the levels of the BY variable or variables.  The X axes are unaffected.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies that both the legend group values and the X axis scaling are shared between all of the  levels of the BY variable or variables. The Y axes are unaffected. This option is applicable only  when the GROUP= option is specified for the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies that both the legend group values and the Y axis scaling are shared between all of the  levels of the BY variable or variables. The X axes are unaffected. This option is applicable only  when the GROUP= option is specified for the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Specifies that both the legend group values and the axis scaling are shared between all of the  levels of the BY variable(s).

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENDPLOT;
      
Ends a BEGINSGPLOT statement block.
Syntax: PLOT parameter(s) </ options>
Syntax:  SPLINE X=variable Y=variable </option(s)>;

Syntax: CONTINUE;
      
Enables the next iteration of the loop to process without skipping any code in between.

Syntax: DEFAULT <CLEAR> <PRINT> <RESULT= variable-name> <STATUS= variable-name> <TOGGLE>; 
      
Enables you to configure how CASL will process certain statements.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Clears the default variable for RESULT= or STATUS=.
Prints the STATUS= of the disp and logs state.

Syntax: RESULT=variable
          
Sets the default variable where results from an action can be saved to.

Syntax: STATUS=variable
          
sets the default variable where status and severity codes from an action can be saved to.
Displays the disposition or logs for an action.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: GLOBAL variable;
      
Declares a variable that has global scope.

variable
symbolic name for a value that can be used in an expression. The value can be a list, a dictionary, 
or a simple data types (string, integer, or floating-point number). You can assign a value throughout 
a program. In CASL there are global, local, and parameter variables.
Syntax: OUTPUT <ODS | LOG>;

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: specifies that the output is sent to an ODS destination.
specifies that the output is sent to the SAS log.

StatementHelp.#cdata: Syntax: UPLOAD PATH=path-to-file <options>

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PATH=path-to-file
          
Specifies the path to the file to upload. The path must be fully qualified from a directory 
that the SAS client can access.

Syntax: CASOUT={output-table-options}
          
Specifies the settings for a basic output table. The following parameters can be specified: 
  CASLIB= “string” 
  INDEXVARS={ “variable-name-1” <, “variable-name-2, ” ...>} 
  LABEL= “string” 
  NAME= “table-name” 
  PROMOTE=TRUE | FALSE 
  REPLACE=TRUE | FALSE 
  REPLICATION=integer

Syntax: IMPORTOPTIONS={FILETYPE="BASESAS"|"CSV"|"DTA"|"ESP"|"EXCEL"|"FMT"|"HDAT"|"JMP"|"LASR"|"SPSS"|"XLS", fileType-specific-parameters}> 

Specifies the file format and options.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DELETE value
      
Deletes the specified value from memory.

value
  definition of the location for the value that is to be deleted. The value can be a variable, 
  list, array, or a dictionary.

Syntax: EXIT expression;
      
Exits the current block of CASL code.

Syntax: FNC category-name; 

Lists all common functions by name and category with simple descriptions. 

category-name
specifies the name of the category to display functions from.

Syntax: DO <var> = <start> [TO <stop>] [BY increment] [ WHILE (condition) | UNTIL(condition)]; statements; END; 
      
This is a traditional do loop. <var> is the loop variable. <start> is the initial value of the variable. 
<stop> is the ending value. an increment can be specified. A while condition may evaluated after the loop 
increment and break out on false. The until condition will be evaluated at the end of the loop.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DO <var> = <start> [TO <stop>]
          
For use in a DO statement.

Syntax: DO <var> = <start> [TO <stop>] [BY increment]
          
For use in a DO statement.

Syntax: DO WHILE (condition); statements; END;
          
This is a traditional do while loop. Loop until the condition is false.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: END; 
      
Ends a DO group or SELECT group processing.

Syntax: FILE fileref <options>;
      
The FILE statement enables the user to specify different locations for output. The FILE statement 
changes the active output location to the specified file. Each "fileref" has a name. The name can 
be used to change the active file to that fileref at any time. The default output behavior can be 
accessed using the "ods" fileref.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FILE ODS;
          
Specifies the ODS destination.

Syntax: FILE LOG;
          
Specifies the LOG destination.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PRINT <expr> <expr> ...;
      
Print displays the value of the expression to the current output location. Note that PRINT is not PUT.
PUT has the same behavior as data step. 

If the value is a list, the list will be traversed and each item displayed. If the item is a Table 
it will be printed to the current output location. If that location is ODS, then ODS will process the 
printing of the table. 

To bypass ODS and print to the log, use "output log; print table; output ods;"

Syntax: IMPORT <extension-name>;
      
Loads the function in the specified extension and adds it to the list of available functions.

Optional Argument:
extension-name
  The name of the import extension.

Syntax: DEPORT caslext;

This will unload the functions previously loaded with import.

Syntax: FUNCTIONLIST < name >; | FLIST <name>;
      
Print a list of available functions. 

Optional Argument:
name
  The name of the available functions. The optional name qualifies the list. 

   fnc - tkfnc (DS2 functions)
   bi - built-in functions
   install - functions registered by the application
   internal - internal functions
   <name> - imported function by extension name

If no name is given all functions are listed.

Syntax: RETURN (value); 
      
Returns a value from the current function. If the current function is the top-level Proc CAS function, 
this exits the program and sets the value into a macro variable named _casrc for use by the next step. 
In the latter case the returned value will be converted to string.

Syntax: GOTO label; 

Transfer control to the label.

Syntax: IF expression THEN statement; [else statement;] 
      
Traditional IF statement a la DS1

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
If the conditions that are specified in the IF clause are met, the IF-THEN statement executes a SAS 
statement for observations that are read from a SAS data set, for records in an external file, or 
for computed values.
Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.
WHEN statement in an IF-THEN-WHEN construct.
Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.
Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.

Action statement in an IF-THEN construct. 
          
Stops execution of the current DATA step.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ELSE statement;
      
The ELSE goes with the if statement.

Syntax: LEAVE; 
      
Stops processing the current loop and resumes with the next statement in the sequence. 

The LEAVE statement stops the processing of the current DO loop or SELECT group and continues 
processing with the next statement following the DO loop or SELECT group.

Syntax: ON condition response <expression> 
      
The "ON" condition allows the user to specify how to handle an error during execution.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Supported condition]
          
A floating point exception has occurred.

[Supported condition]
          
An access violation has occurred.

[Supported condition]
          
A user has raised an interrupt to stop the processing of the current operation.

[Supported condition]
          
An abort has been raised.

[Supported condition]
          
An operation failed during expression evaluation.

[Supported condition]
          
An unknown variable has been used during expression evaluation.

[Supported condition]
          
An illegal operation has been detected during expression evaluation.

[Supported condition]
          
A mixed array or dictionary has been detected.

[Supported condition]
          
The function name  has not been defined.

[Supported condition]
          
This condition can be raised by a user for their own purpose.

[Supported condition]
          
This condition can be raised by a user for their own purpose.

[Valid response]
          
Replace the operation with the value of the expression specified.

[Valid response]
          
Propagate the condition to the previous frame.

[Valid response]
          
Cancel execution.

[Valid response]
          
Ignore this if possible and continue. Otherwise this will be handled as a cancel.

[Valid response]
          
If this error occurs within a function, have the function return the expression value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PRINTLST <expr> <expr> ...;
      
Print displays the value of the expression to the "LST" file defined by the application. 
For SAS this is the listing file. 

If the value is a list, the list will be traversed and each item displayed. if the item is a Table 
it will be printed to the current output location. If that location is ODS, then ODS will process 
the printing of the table.

Syntax: SELECT [(select-expression)]; 
      
Select can accept an expression. If provided, this is the expression for comparison on a when statement 
that follows. If a when statement is specified, there can be multiple expressions specified. The expressions 
are evaluated and compared either to the given select expression or to TRUE if no expression is given.

Syntax: RAISE condition;  
      
Sends a signal to the calling process.

Required Argument:
condition
  One or more numeric or character expressions that result in a value on which some decision depends.

Syntax: ENDSOURCE;
      
Ends a SOURCE statement block.

Syntax: SAVERESULT variable-name <NOREPLACE> DATAOUT=<libref.>member-name | lib=libref | file=<path-name| filename> | CASLIB=<caslib> | CASOUT=name
      
Creates a SAS data set from the results of an ACTION.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies to not overwrite the files that are saved.

Syntax: DATAOUT=<libref.>member-name
          
Specifies the SAS library and data set name to use. The default libref is "work".

Syntax: LIB=libref
          
Specifies the SAS library to use. This syntax is useful when you have a list of tkctbs, such as 
the results of a summary action that used the groupBy parameter. In this case, SAS data sets named 
summary1 - summaryn are created.

Syntax: FILE=<path-name | filename>
          
Specifies the file or filename to use. This syntax is useful when you have a single tkctb.

Syntax: CASLIB=<casref>
          
Specifies the CASLIB to use. This syntax is useful when you have a list of tkctbs, such as the 
results of a summary action that used the groupBy parameter. In this case, CASLIB tables sets 
named summary1 - summaryn are created.

Syntax: CASOUT=name
          
Specifies the name of the table to use. This syntax is useful when you have a single tkctb.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
UNSET <DISP> <LOGS>;
      
Controls message suppression in the SAS log.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies to suppress printing the disposition in the SAS log.
Specifies to suppress printing messages from CAS in the SAS log.
